shamir-2024-redshift.an empirical consis.title: an empirical consistent redshift bias: a possible direct reproducible observation of zwicky's tl theory

fritz-zwicky.fritz zwicky....proposed ti.name: fritz zwicky
sources: proposed tired-light theory in 1929, referenced in paper shamir-2024-redshift

tired-light-theory.tired light theory.00.name: tired light theory
tired-light-theory.tired light theory.00.summary: theory proposed by fritz zwicky that photons lose energy as they travel through space, causing redshift without requiring expansion. in extreme form, argues the big bang is an artifact and the universe is in steady state. the theory has lacked direct empirical evidence until potentially this observation.

standard-cosmological-model.standard cos.name: standard cosmological model (lambda-cdm)
standard-cosmological-model.standard cos.summary: the standard model of cosmology based on dark energy (lambda) and cold dark matter (cdm). assumes redshift is primarily due to cosmic expansion and hubble flow. faces tensions including h0 tension and unexpected mature galaxies at high redshifts observed by jwst.

redshift-assumption-rotational-velocity-.statement: the rotational velocity of the milky way galaxy relative to observed galaxies has a negligible effect on redshift measurements
redshift-assumption-rotational-velocity-.rationale: standard redshift models assume rotational velocity is far smaller than linear velocity and can be ignored when measuring cosmological redshift

redshift-assumption-purely-velocity-base.statement: redshift corresponds primarily to the linear velocity of objects relative to earth due to cosmic expansion
redshift-assumption-purely-velocity-base.rationale: standard cosmological model interprets redshift as doppler effect from hubble flow and cosmic expansion

shamir-claim-redshift-bias-rotational.ti.statement: galaxies that rotate in the same direction relative to the milky way have higher mean redshift than galaxies rotating in the opposite direction, with the difference increasing at higher redshifts

shamir-claim-consistent-across-datasets..statement: the redshift bias is consistent across multiple datasets: sdss, desi legacy survey, hsc dr3, and third-party catalogs, using different telescopes, annotation methods, and covering both northern and southern galactic poles

shamir-claim-delta-z-increases-redshift..statement: the redshift difference (δz) between galaxies rotating in opposite directions increases with redshift, from ~0.0007-0.0016 at z<0.1 to ~0.0059-0.0070 at z=0.2-0.3

shamir-claim-h0-tension-explanation.tire.statement: redshift bias can explain the h0 tension: selecting sh0es supernovae by rotation direction changes h0 from ~73.7 to ~69.05 km/s/mpc (same direction) or ~74.2 km/s/mpc (opposite direction), bringing same-direction value within error of cmb measurements

shamir-claim-flux-differences.tired-ligh.statement: galaxies rotating in opposite directions show ~10% flux differences in different filters, with larger absolute differences at shorter wavelengths

shamir-prediction-higher-redshift-bias.t.statement: the redshift bias will be more significant at higher redshifts (z>0.3) observed by jwst, potentially explaining mature galaxies in the early universe

shamir-prediction-jwst-asymmetry-explana.statement: the observed 140% excess of galaxies rotating opposite to milky way in jwst deep fields is due to brightness differences from doppler shift combined with tired-light effects that become more significant at greater distances

h0-tension.h0 tension.discrepancy betwee.name: h0 tension
h0-tension.h0 tension.discrepancy betwee.description: discrepancy between two different methods of measuring the hubble constant: local distance ladder measurements (~73-74 km/s/mpc) versus cmb measurements (~67 km/s/mpc), suggesting different expansion rates and ages of the universe

mature-galaxies-high-redshift.mature gal.name: mature galaxies at high redshift
mature-galaxies-high-redshift.mature gal.description: jwst observations of mature, massive galaxies at redshifts z>11-15 that appear older than traditional galaxy formation models predict, challenging the standard cosmological timeline

redshift-rotational-bias.redshift bias f.name: redshift bias from rotational velocity
redshift-rotational-bias.redshift bias f.description: systematic redshift difference between galaxies rotating in the same versus opposite direction relative to the milky way, with bias increasing at higher redshifts. this suggests redshift is not purely velocity-based and may be affected by rotational velocity or tired-light effects.

redshift-bias-violates-rotational-neglig.violation_description: the observed redshift bias shows that rotational velocity of the milky way relative to observed galaxies does have a measurable effect on redshift, contradicting the assumption that it is negligible

redshift-bias-violates-purely-velocity.r.violation_description: the redshift bias that increases with distance (redshift) suggests redshift is not purely velocity-based, as the rotational velocity of the milky way is constant and cannot explain distance-dependent effects

workflow_strengths: Successfully extracted and analyzed paper content
Created comprehensive entity structure covering theories, assumptions, claims, predictions, and anomalies
Properly linked violations between assumptions and anomalies
Identified key cosmological tensions and their potential explanations

ai_feedback.session_summary: Analyzed Shamir 2024 paper on empirical redshift bias. Created entities for: paper (shamir-2024-redshift), persons (Lior Shamir, Fritz Zwicky), theories (Tired Light Theory, Standard Cosmological Model), 2 assumptions about redshift, 5 verified claims about redshift bias observations, 2 predictions about higher redshift effects, 3 anomalies (H0 tension, mature galaxies at high redshift, redshift rotational bias), and 2 violated assumption links. The analysis captures the paper's key finding that redshift bias depends on galaxy rotation direction relative to Milky Way, increasing with redshift, potentially supporting Zwicky's tired-light theory and explaining cosmological tensions.
ai_feedback.entities_created_summary: 18 entities: 1 paper, 2 persons, 2 theories, 2 assumptions, 5 claims, 2 predictions, 3 anomalies, 2 violated_assumptions
ai_feedback.challenges_encountered: None significant - paper was well-structured and analysis proceeded smoothly
ai_feedback.what_worked_well: Clear paper structure made it easy to extract key claims, assumptions, and predictions. The model structure accommodated all necessary entities well.
ai_feedback.suggestions_for_improvement: Could potentially add more detailed statistical information from the paper tables, but core findings are well captured
ai_feedback.model_insights: The paper presents empirical evidence challenging standard cosmological assumptions about redshift, with potential implications for understanding H0 tension and JWST observations of early Universe galaxies.
